Topic.Title: What Is The Best Picture Size For The Game?

Posts.EditableText: What is the best picture size for the game?  As in the game screen is set to maximum/full screen.  What is the pixel size or resolution etc.?  I am not sure of the terminology.  X/Y or what ever.
Posts.HTML: What is the best picture size for the game?  As in the game screen is set to maximum/full screen.  What is the pixel size or resolution etc.?  I am not sure of the terminology.  X/Y or what ever.

Posts.EditableText: Hi I've set mine at 500 x 300 through some jasc software but mine's for a tablet not a laptop. I would like to know how you can set a picture for percentage and not pixels. That way the pic would alter itself to match the size of the screen.

Posts.EditableText: Hi i have a jasc software with which i can alter any pic size and upload it to the game i am making. As i stated for my tablet i find the best for me is 500 x 300 pixels. The other matter was just a comment, however it would be nice to be able to save the size of the pic to a percentage so that no matter what the size of the screen would be the pic would alter itself. eg if the size of the pic was at 80% then no matter what the screen size is then the pic would always be at 80% of the screen. Frontpage and dreamweaver are but two of web creators that allow for this, hopefully at some point Alex might be able to build this into future versions.
Posts.HTML: Hi i have a jasc software with which i can alter any pic size and upload it to the game i am making. As i stated for my tablet i find the best for me is 500 x 300 pixels. The other matter was just a comment, however it would be nice to be able to save the size of the pic to a percentage so that no matter what the size of the screen would be the pic would alter itself. eg if the size of the pic was at 80% then no matter what the screen size is then the pic would always be at 80% of the screen. Frontpage and dreamweaver are but two of web creators that allow for this, hopefully at some point Alex might be able to build this into future versions.
